discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
In the exhibit, the authentication method is set to AAA, and the AAA Server Group is set to LOCAL. However, the problem states that the user is unable to authenticate using local credentials. This typically means the LOCAL AAA server group is either not properly configured or not recognized by the system.

For AAA-based authentication to work properly, even with local users, the AAA server group (LOCAL) must be correctly configured and referenced in the ASA configuration.
check box for ssl connections isnt enabled so A make sense

Selected Answer: C
Change method to "LOCAL"

Selected Answer: A
A is correct

AAA Server Group is already configured as local.
But at the bottom the ssl client is not activated


so A is correct

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. A network engineer is configuring a remote access SSLVPN and is unable to complete the connection using local credentials. What must be done to remediate this problem?

choices.C: Change the authentication method to local.
choices.B: Configure a AAA server group to authenticate the client.
choices.A: Enable the client protocol in the Cisco AnyConnect profile.
choices.D: Configure the group policy to force local authentication.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CE
It's C, E. 
Registration reply/request in present in all DMVPN phases
Resolution reply/request in only in DMVPN phase 3

Selected Answer: BC
**E. Resolution request**: While this is used in Phase 3, it is not exclusive to Phase 3 and is also used in Phase 2.

Selected Answer: BE
BE is correct

C&E for sure,
Registration reply/request in present in all DMVPN phases.
Resolution reply/request in Only DMVPN phase 3.
HTH

Selected Answer: BE
I agree above, it should be B & E
https://ine.com/blog/2008-12-23-dmvpn-phase-3
"NRHP Phase 3 involves spokes in responding to NHRP resolution requests. 
... Step 3:

Let's say an mGRE tunnel is configured for NHRP redirects (the first magic component of NHRP Phase 3). "...

BC is the correct answer. In DMVPN Phase 3 implementation, the two NHRP (Next Hop Resolution Protocol) functions that are specific to it are resolution reply and redirect. 1. Resolution reply: This function is used by the hub router to respond to NHRP resolution requests by providing the mapping information (such as the real IP address of the spoke router). 2. Redirect: This function is used by the hub router to inform the spoke router that a more optimal path to reach a destination is available through a different spoke router. The redirect message allows the spoke router to update its routing table and use the more efficient path. These functions help in the dynamic establishment of tunnels and efficient data routing in DMVPN Phase.
BC are correct

discussion.content: First, tunnelall to ensure all trafic is passing through ASA (so answer is A or D). second, we need 500 users so the Pool in D is not ensuring this requirement (only 254 ip) so Answer is A
A is correct. Tunnel All for all traffic through the FW. And the /22 pool allows for 500 and more users.
I would go with "A" too, since "all traffic" includes 192.168.0.0/24
Users have to access all devices on the subnet 192.168.0.0/24. So correct answer should be B, as tunnel all policy will allow access to everything and not just the internal subnet of 192.168.0.0

comments.content: in this case , should have been exclude specified

"ensures all traffic from the client passes through the ASA" that is one of the requirements. Meaning all traffic should pass through the tunnel, I know they mention 192.168.0.0 network but that is just to confuse.
Correct Answer is A

comments.content: Tunnel Groups are ASA feature to support the use of differnt connection, but ASA support two crypto modes - L7 SSL (webvpn-attributes) and L3 IPSec (ipsec-attributes); both forms support remote access & site-2-site/L2L. You can rule out SSL VPNs because the TG is using ipsec.. process elimination is EZVPN.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Both AnyConnect and Easy have tunnel-group syntax because it is an ASA, however client address-pool is utilized in AnyConnect IPSec. Easy uses a different manual config on each remote.
For SSL VPN, the tunnel groups must use "webvpn-attributes" module
This configuration is for the easy vpn server part
